summary: This document is an email chain from October 28, 2019, concerning the scheduling of a meeting for Mark Epstein. The participants, including an Assistant United States Attorney, are coordinating a meeting time, with confusion over whether it was set for October 28 or October 31.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The individual for whom a meeting is being scheduled; a client flying in from Florida.

events.title: Scheduled meeting confusion
events.description: Email correspondence reveals confusion and rescheduling of a meeting concerning Mark Epstein, originally set for October 28 but being moved to October 31.

events.title: Proposed meeting date
events.description: A meeting is proposed and confirmed for October 31 at 3:00 p.m. regarding Mark Epstein.

keyFacts: The email chain involves scheduling a legal meeting concerning Mark Epstein, brother of Jeffrey Epstein.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is a participant in the correspondence.
There is confusion over the meeting date, with one party confirming for October 28 and another for October 31.
Mark Epstein is noted to be flying in from Florida for the meeting.
